meanings.definition: A person or group that controls access to something
meanings.sent1: The gatekeepers at the museum checked our tickets before letting us in.
meanings.sent2: The gatekeepers of the company only allow authorized personnel to enter the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The gatekeepers of the exclusive club made sure only members could enjoy the luxurious amenities.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cybersecurity, firewalls act as digital gatekeepers protecting sensitive information.
meanings.sent5: The gatekeepers of the ancient castle guarded the entrance with vigilance.

meanings.definition: A person or group that decides what is allowed or accepted
meanings.sent1: The gatekeepers of fashion magazines determine which trends make it to the pages.
meanings.sent2: In the publishing industry, editors serve as gatekeepers for quality content.
meanings.sent3: The gatekeepers of the art gallery carefully select which pieces will be displayed to the public.
meanings.sent4: Parents often act as gatekeepers for their children's screen time, regulating usage.
meanings.sent5: The gatekeepers of the film industry have the power to greenlight or reject movie projects.
